entry.title: üáÆüá≥ SAP Build: Create Event-Based Processes (Bengaluru, India)
entry.content:
This is the all-new SAP CodeJam for SAP Build low-code/no-code tooling that focuses on giving you hands-on experience for building event-triggered processes with SAP Build Process Automation.

 

You will build an event-based scenario that lets users create S/4HANA business partners, setting off a process where:
  1. An employee approves the creation of a site access badge.
  2. A second employee, determined based on the details of the business partner, may also need to approve the badge.
  3. The process calls an external, 3rd-party badge system and waits to be called back.
  4. A user creates the badge and the badge system calls back the process instance.
  5. A notification with the badge ID is sent.

 

The scenario is built in 2 halves:

 

SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh: You will learn about events, CloudEvents, events in the SAP landscape, the process for publishing and subscribing to events, and your way around SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. Then, you will create a REST Delivery Point in advanced event mesh to forward events to your SAP Build on your SAP BTP trial account.
 
SAP Build Process Automation: You will create a process from scratch to handle the issuance of site access badges. You will learn the basics of SAP Build Process Automation (projects, triggers, conditions, creating instances, monitoring, and the Inbox), and also use some of the more recent or advanced features (event triggers, form events, waiting for a API callback).
 
Prerequisites
  • Bring your own laptop with power adapter and have a supported Web browser such as Google Chrome or Firefox installed on your laptop.
  • It can be helpful to bring a tablet or second laptop, if you have.
  • Complete these prerequisites and the required reading BEFORE you come: 
    • Introduction to the CodeJam
    • Prerequisites
    • Required reading:
      • 1 - Exploring Events and More in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub
      • 2 - Why Event-Driven Architectures?

Location and Date

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Wednesday, December 10th, 2025 from 10:30 - 16:00 local time in Bengaluru, India. The language of the event and the content will be English. 

Event Address: Bosch EC3 (360¬∞ Business Park), Electronic City Phase I, Doddathoguru, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

Google maps location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/nFkWrsEptwqE3ExL7

  • The instructors are SAP Developer Advocates  @ajay_soreng  and @Rekha_DR 
  • Thank you Robert Bosch for hosting this event.

Please note that spaces are limited! We can only accommodate 35 attendees. If you want to attend, register by clicking the Yes button in the Will you be attending? section above to the right. About two weeks before the event, you will be asked to confirm your attendance via email.

entry.title: Re: Message no. VL171
entry.content:
I encountered the same issue, and the root cause was that I attempted to post a Goods Issue directly from a Sales Order item while the inspection lot trigger for outbound delivery was active.

The problem occurs due to a quality block when you try to post the goods issue without completing a positive usage decision. I resolved this by configuring a Quality Info Record (QV51) for the customer to allow inspection ‚ÄúAfter Delivery.‚Äù With this setup, the error no longer appeared.

Additionally, it is also possible to follow the standard process for this inspection scenario:
Create the delivery ‚Üí Record inspection results and make a positive usage decision ‚Üí Post the Goods Issue.

entry.title: Re: Display PDF document as RAP Odata V4 Web API output
entry.content:
I would like to understand why you are trying to create a new service, when a standard service is already available: https://api.sap.com/api/API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/overview

Your custom service should only expose the attachment keys, and then whoever needs to read the attachment, may use the above service to read attachment contents. You may read the attachment keys using:

CL_ATTACHMENT_SERVICE_API=>GET_INSTANCE( )->IF_ATTACHMENT_SERVICE_API~GET_LIST_OF_ATTACHMENTS

entry.title: Re: The Power of One: How Unified SAP Joule Boosts AI Adoption (a technical sight)
entry.content:
Hi @normann 

Below the fragment we got as a response from SAP on this with puts a HUGE limitation on using 3rd party IDP as UUID source. The suggested approach to make sure the user is "created first" by the Entra Synch is very complex to achieve. I just expect some option to limit the writeback or some other alternative. Otherwise the scenario to use 3rd party UUID in only something SAP writes in a nice architecture diagram and not something that can be actually achieved.

"....

  • The Global User ID is designed to be a stable and unique technical identifier across connected systems. In the default SuccessFactors‚ÄìIAS integration, IAS generates this ID and writes it back to SuccessFactors (see SAP Note 0003530083).

  • In hybrid landscapes, it is technically possible to overwrite the Global User ID in SuccessFactors via IPS mappings, but this is not the recommended approach, as the identifier is expected to remain consistent once assigned.

  • The recommended best practice is to configure the leading system (in your case, Entra ID) to provision the Global User ID into IAS. IAS then becomes the central broker and propagates the value to SuccessFactors, Ariba, S/4HANA, and other connected solutions. This avoids the need for overwrites and ensures consistency from the start.

.....

....in the standard SuccessFactors‚ÄìIAS integration, the Global User ID is written back from IAS into SuccessFactors as part of the delivered flow. This is not triggered by any custom job or transformation but is part of the standard integration design (see SAP Note 3530083).

Currently, there is no configuration option in SuccessFactors or IAS to disable this writeback. The UUID propagation is mandatory and not switchable.

To avoid IAS generating a random UUID that is then written back, the recommended best practice is to ensure that the Global User ID is already provisioned from your leading system (e.g., Entra ID) into IAS before the SuccessFactors‚ÄìIAS synchronization runs. In this way, IAS will use the Entra-provisioned identifier instead of generating its own value.

If your requirement is to suppress the writeback entirely or to have a configuration ‚Äúswitch‚Äù to control this behavior, this goes beyond current product capabilities and would be considered a product enhancement..... "

entry.title: In ABAP Unit, failing to get the number of available workprocesses for pRFC
entry.content:
I'm trying to create a framework over pRFC (CALL FUNCTION ... IN BACKGROUND TASK ...)

I want to test the framework via ABAP Unit, in one of my tests I need to get the number of available workprocesses for pRFC to stress the framework.

There are two possibilities to get this number but both of them fail:

  1. Call SPBT_INITIALIZE to get the number and it works, but the code under test fails because it tries again to call SPBT_INITIALIZE, which is forbidden in the same internal session (exception PBT_ENV_ALREADY_INITIALIZED).
  2. Call SPBT_GET_CURR_RESOURCE_INFO, but the exception PBT_ENV_NOT_INITIALIZED_YET is raised because SPBT_INITIALIZE has not been called before.

Thanks.

Sandra

entry.title: Re: In ABAP Unit, failing to get the number of available workprocesses for pRFC
entry.content:
In ABAP Unit, call successively:

  • SPBT_INITIALIZE
  • SPBT_GET_CURR_RESOURCE_INFO to get the number of available workprocesses for pRFC

In your framework, call successively:

  • SPBT_INITIALIZE and ignore the exception PBT_ENV_ALREADY_INITIALIZED
  • SPBT_GET_CURR_RESOURCE_INFO to get the number of available workprocesses for pRFC

entry.title: Re: I am getting a blank page when I preview my RAP servi...
entry.content:
Before you do anything with security or anything else, please give the system some breathing/sleeping time.

This is utterly annoying, but we have faced this issue so many times in S/4 Public Cloud. There is some cache somewhere, invisible to us, that doesn't get updated/refreshed whenever a new binding/application is published and until that happens, the UCON error will continue to happen.

Unfortunately, requests to SAP to provide us a method to clear/reset the cache ourselves, was denied.

So, this what we do as workarounds:

  1. Add the CDS to an existing already published Service Definition. Since this is an existing service, the newly added CDS will be readily available via this service. We have a local/test Service Definition created in Dev system, exactly for this purpose.
  2. Wait for a few hours for the cache to be cleared (sometimes it takes a whole night) for your new service endpoint to work.

entry.title: How to update ‚ÄúDisplay-only‚Äù material master fields (Gross/Net Weight) via MM17 or IDoc in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working in S/4HANA and I have a scenario with material master fields MARA-BRGEW (Gross Weight) and MARA-NTGEW (Net Weight).

  • In MM02, these fields are set to Display only via field selection (OMS9/OMS2).

  • I want to update these fields via MM17 (mass maintenance) or MATMAS IDoc.

  • Currently, SAP blocks the change and returns MG140: ‚ÄúField not ready for input‚Äù.

I understand that SAP marks these fields as non-dialog in the backend, so the ‚ÄúDisplay only‚Äù status does not allow updates through direct input or IDocs.

My question:
Is there a standard / S/4HANA-supported way to update these display-only fields programmatically (via IDoc, MM17, or API), without changing the MM02 screen status?

entry.title: Re: SAP DRC, Peppol / Error at PUSH operation HTTP respon...
entry.content:
Click on the 'Failed to push document'. The error details will be downloaded in a .txt file. It will give you details like error code and error message.

We faced a similar issue with the error - 'Server returned HTTP response code: 401 for URL: http://..................../pushrequest' & 'Header null - HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized'. 

The root cause was identified as a password change for the user configured in the 'Destinations' section of our subaccount. - Setting Up Connectivity | SAP Help Portal'

Below trouble shooting guides helped in resolving this issue:

Troubleshooting Malaysia eDocument integration with DRC Cloud edition | SAP Help Portal

3605221 - eDocument Stuck in "Acknowledged by Service" with HTTP 401 Error During PUSH Step - SAP for Me

3498170 - Troubleshooting guide: Electronic communication integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition and SAP applications - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Certification - Sourcing and Procurement - Difference...
entry.content:
HI @AnnaLucini 

  • C_TS452
    This certification verifies that you possess the cores and core skills in the area of sourcing and procurement line of business area required of the consultant profile and proves that you have an overall understanding and in-depth skills to participate as a member of a project team with a focus on the planning and implementation phases in a mentored role.
    This certification is relevant for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition and SAP S/4HANA on-premise.
    To prepare for this certification, it is necessary to take the Learning Journey Managing Clean Core, in addition to the Learning Journey displayed under "Recommended steps to prepare for the exam".
    Please access our SAP Certified Associate - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Sourcing and Procurement
    site for more details.
  • C_S4CPR
    This certification verifies that you possess the fundamental knowledge required to explain and execute core implementation project tasks to deploy, adopt and extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as well as core knowledge in Sourcing & Procurement. It proves that the candidate has an overall understanding and in-depth technical skills to participate as a member of a SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementation project team with a focus on Sourcing & Procurement in a mentored role.
         Please cees our SAP CERTIFICATION C_S4CPR SAP Certified Associate - Implementation Consultant - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Sourcing and Procurement site for more details.

Margit

entry.title: Invitation to the SAP Community Stammtisch Berlin on the Eve of SAP TechEd 2025!
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, dear friends and valued colleagues,

The SAP Community is finally reuniting at SAP TechEd in Berlin this year, and what better way to kick off the week, than getting together for a Stammtisch at one of Berlin‚Äôs breweries?

Whether you are from Berlin or traveling to Berlin for SAP TechEd ‚Äì this evening is for you. 

When? Monday, November 3, 2025, from 6:30 PM

Where? Hofbr√§u Wirtshaus Berlin, Karl-Liebknecht-Str. 30, 10178 Berlin

 It is an open and informal networking event for everyone, organized by the SAP Community Group Berlin.

We look forward to a sociable evening with great conversations and hope many of you will take the time to stop by. You are welcome to stay the whole evening, or just stop by to say hi. 

This get-together is the perfect opportunity to:

  • Reconnect with old acquaintances: Meet up with friends and colleagues from the community

  • Make new contacts: Get to know other SAP experts and newcomers -no one should leave the event without speaking to at least two new people you have not met before üôÇ
  • Conversations: This Stammtisch is all about the conversations, and the community getting together face-to-face again. Get the week started by discussing the latest SAP technology announcements, or keep it casual and catch up on everything that has happened since we last met (not necessarily technology related). 

To help us with the planning, we kindly ask you to confirm your attendance via the RSVP button of this event post.

Important Note: Please be aware that all attendees are responsible for their own food and drinks!

We can't wait to see you there!

Best regards, Your SAP Community Group Berlin Team

-----------------------------

Liebe SAP Community, liebe Freunde und gesch√§tzte Kollegen,

die SAP Community kommt dieses Jahr endlich wieder zur SAP TechEd in Berlin zusammen! Und wie k√∂nnte man die Woche besser einl√§uten, als mit einem gemeinsamen Stammtisch in einem Berliner Brauhaus?

Egal, ob ihr aus Berlin kommt oder f√ºr die SAP TechEd anreist ‚Äì dieser Abend ist f√ºr euch.

Wann: Montag, den 03. November 2025, ab 18:30 Uhr

Wo: Hofbr√§u Wirtshaus Berlin, Karl-Liebknecht-Str. 30, 10178 Berlin

Es handelt sich um ein offenes und ungezwungenes Networking-Event f√ºr alle, organisiert von der SAP Community Group Berlin.

Wir freuen uns auf einen geselligen Abend mit tollen Gespr√§chen und hoffen, dass viele von euch die Zeit finden, vorbeizuschauen. Ihr seid herzlich eingeladen, den ganzen Abend zu bleiben oder auch nur kurz auf ein "Hallo" hereinzukommen.

Dieses Treffen ist die perfekte Gelegenheit f√ºr:

  • Wiedersehen mit alten Bekannten: Trefft Freunde und Kollegen aus der Community.

  • Kn√ºpfen neuer Kontakte: Lernt andere SAP-Experten und Neulinge kennen ‚Äì niemand sollte den Abend beenden, ohne mit mindestens zwei neuen Personen gesprochen zu haben, die er oder sie vorher noch nicht kannte üôÇ
  • Gespr√§che: Bei diesem Stammtisch dreht sich alles um den Austausch und das pers√∂nliche Wiedersehen der Community. Startet die Woche mit Diskussionen √ºber die neuesten Ank√ºndigungen zur SAP-Technologie oder haltet es ganz entspannt und tauscht euch dar√ºber aus, was seit unserem letzten Treffen so alles passiert ist (nicht zwingend technologiebezogen).

Um uns die Planung zu erleichtern, bitten wir euch, eure Teilnahme √ºber den RSVP-Button dieses Beitrags zu best√§tigen.

Wichtiger Hinweis: Bitte beachtet, dass alle Teilnehmer f√ºr ihre Speisen und Getr√§nke selbst aufkommen!

Wir k√∂nnen es kaum erwarten, euch zu sehen!

Viele Gr√º√üe, Euer Team der SAP Community Group Berlin

entry.title: BTP Trial Update: CF Runtime Availability
entry.content:
Dear SAP BTP trial community,

 
We always aimed to give users the most freedom and flexibility in the SAP BTP trial to ensure that everyone can test and explore our software or use it for learning purposes. For the next weeks, the SAP BTP trial will not be able to deliver this experience for new SAP BTP trial accounts as we have to prioritize the security and reliability of our SAP BTP trial system. We are experiencing an unusually high amount of misuse limiting the availability for all of our users. 
 
Therefore, we decided to temporarily reduce the offering for the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime for new BTP Trial Accounts. You will still be able to build applications and preview them, but deployment in the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime will not be possible for the next weeks. 
 
How can you still explore SAP BTP? 
  • All other services will remain available and can be explored on the SAP Discovery Center
  • Leverage our SAP Basic trial offerings 
  • As a partner: Refer to our newly released free TDD licenses
  • As a customer: Leverage the free tier offering as part of Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP available in the SAP Store
 

All updates will be posted in the SAP Community. 

If you have an existing account, you are not affected. 
 
See you soon, 
SAP BTP trial product team

These innovations empower compliance teams to:
Improve operational efficiency

entry.title: IAM for SAP Joule
entry.content:
üîê IAM for SAP Joule: Building Secure, Scalable AI Experiences
As organizations embrace SAP Joule and SAP Business AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) becomes the backbone of secure and seamless integration across business applications. Here‚Äôs what you need to know:

‚úÖ Why IAM Matters for Joule
SAP Joule is more than a conversational AI‚Äîit connects processes and data across multiple SAP applications. To achieve this, robust IAM architecture ensures:
Cross-domain access without compromising security.
Consistent user experience across integrated apps.
Compliance with enterprise cybersecurity standards.

üîë Core IAM Components
SAP Cloud Identity Services
Joule uses these services as its user store, enabling centralized identity management and role-based access.
OpenID Connect (OIDC)
The recommended protocol for secure integration between Joule and SAP Business AI.
Role Mapping & Session Management
Content is exposed based on role names, and user-to-role assignments occur dynamically during sessions.

üõ† Integration Flow
Initial Setup: Configure Joule with SAP Cloud Identity Services.
Common Data Model (CDM): Define which Joule functions map to specific roles.
Cross-Application IAM: Once the first app integrates with Joule, subsequent apps reuse the same IAM patterns.

üåê Navigation & Access
SAP Joule leverages SAP Build Work Zone for unified navigation across applications, ensuring smooth transitions for end users.

üí° Why This Matters
IAM for Joule isn‚Äôt just about authentication‚Äîit‚Äôs about enabling secure, intelligent collaboration across SAP‚Äôs ecosystem. As AI becomes central to enterprise workflows, IAM ensures trust, compliance, and scalability.

üëâ What‚Äôs your take? How do you see IAM evolving as AI-driven platforms like Joule become mainstream?

entry.title: Need help with PRD Audit report on iContent Server use
entry.content:
We have seen a sharp increase in teams loading content into SuccessFactors and we need a reliable audit report to review which files on our iContent server are in use and which are not.

We can pull the list of Content Object/Folders from iContent, but a report on Items which Content Objects linked has proven very difficult to create. I received a report from the Learning SIG, but it doesn't list the ITEM ID. 

  1. Because we also have LinkedIn Learning creating Items in the System, I added a search field for Item ID which then required I add a security profile/line.  I think this is interfering as well.
  2. I tried to link the correct table/columns in and now it either will pull only inactive items or a blank report no matter what I put (or leave blank!) for Item IDs

I need help creating this audit report. Here is my PRD Query:

SELECT 
    pc.CPNT_ID,
    pc.CPNT_TYP_ID,
    pc.COMMENTS,
    pc.CPNT_TITLE,
    pc.REV_DTE, 
    pc.REV_NUM,
    pc.NOTACTIVE as "Item Inactive",
    pc.CPNT_LEN,
pcm.MASTERY_SCORE, 
pcm.COMPLETE_ON_LAUNCH, 
pcm.NODE_NO, 
pcm.MODULE_NAME, 
pcm.EXAM_REVW_ENABLED,                
pca.APP_ID, 
pca.APP_TITLE, 
pca.DESCRIPTION,
pca.IS_ONLINE, 
pca.PRIMARY_PARAM,
pca.SECONDARY_PARAMS, 
pca.ENABLE_MOBILE_ACCESS
 
FROM PA_CPNT pc
 
LEFT JOIN PA_CBT_CPNT_MOD pcm ON pc.CPNT_ID = pcm.CPNT_ID
LEFT JOIN PA_CBT_APPLICATION pca ON pcm.APP_ID = pca.APP_ID
WHERE pc.NOTACTIVE = 'N'
 AND pc.REV_NUM = (
        SELECT MAX(REV_NUM) 
        FROM PA_CPNT 
        WHERE CPNT_ID = pc.CPNT_ID
    )
    /**AND [security:PA_NO_DOMAIN_SECURITY pa]*/
ORDER BY pc.CPNT_ID

entry.title: Meet Joule: Your New AI Assistant in SAP Ariba
entry.content:
Get ready for a smarter, faster way to work. Meet Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, now integrated into the SAP Ariba suite. Think of Joule as your personal assistant, ready to help you navigate the application, answer your questions, and even perform tasks for you‚Äîall through simple, natural language.

Let's explore how Joule will make your day-to-day work in SAP Ariba easier.

(For the latest availability, always check the official Joule Capabilities Guide.)

1. Your On-Demand Ariba Expert

Instead of digging through product documentation on the SAP Help Portal, you can now ask Joule directly. It understands your questions and provides clear, concise answers with direct links to the source documents if you want to learn more. This means less time searching and more time doing.

You can ask questions like:

  • "How do I find registered suppliers? Show me the steps."
  • "How can I track the progress of supplier onboarding?"
  • "What is an aggregated requisition?"
  • "How do I add taxes and discounts to an invoice?"
  • "Can I export questionnaires from a sourcing event?"
  • "What are common invoice exceptions?"

 

 

 

 

2. Turn Conversation into Action

Joule isn't just for answering questions; it's for getting work done. You can use it to interact with the system and manage your business processes without navigating through multiple screens. This feature transforms routine transactional tasks into a simple conversation.

This includes tasks like approving purchase requisitions or performing other create, read, update, and delete actions across Ariba.

For example, you can simply ask:

  • "Show me all tasks that are pending my approval."
  • Once Joule displays the list, you can follow up with: "Approve requisition 9876."

This allows you to handle your to-do list quickly and efficiently, directly from the chat window.

 

 

 

3. Navigate Across Ariba Seamlessly

The SAP Ariba suite contains several powerful applications for buying, sourcing, and supplier management. Joule works across them without missing a beat. You can switch between topics and applications in the same chat window, and Joule will remember the context of your conversation.

Imagine you're asking about a specific supplier's risk profile in Supplier Management. You can immediately pivot and ask, "Show me active sourcing events with this supplier," without having to start a new query. Joule maintains the context, providing a smooth and uninterrupted workflow that saves you from juggling multiple tabs and losing your train of thought.

 

 

 

 

Ready to Get Started? Here's How

You can activate Joule's capabilities in your SAP Ariba applications TODAY. Before you begin, ensure you have the following prerequisites in place:

  • Required Systems & Access:
    • An SAP Ariba Realm.
    • SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) with a Global Administrator.
    • SAP Cloud Identity Services (highly recommended) configured for user logon, along with an administrator for the service.
    • If you are not using SAP Cloud Identity Services, you will need a third-party user with Ariba Core Administrator access.
  • Commercials:
    • Ensure you have the necessary Joule licensing

For a detailed walkthrough of the setup and configuration process, check out the official Joule Integration with SAP Ariba Setup Guide on the SAP Community portal.

Special thanks to Alejandro, Bertrand and Joule Ariba Team for their support.

entry.title: Production Orders created for a specific line are not showing up in SAP ME
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts. 

Our client has 5 SPC Lines. When we create production order for these SPC Lines, the order is assigned to the workcenter as SPC1 (Operation 0020) and SPCW1(Operation 0010) for SPC Line 1. We can see the order in MES system for SPC Line 1 which is a custom screen designed using MII BLS and UI5. When the IDOC is released to MES, it get's processed by a Workflow configured in MII (XSLT file) and the data is stored in MES. 

When we create orders for SPC5 line and released into MES, the order is not visible in MES SPC Line 5 screen. The order has been processed successfully, also available in Shop order maintenance. I also checked in the ROUTER_OPERATION Table in MII, both the 0010 and 0020 operations are available for the order. 

Is there a way to understand why we are not able to see the SPC5 order in the MES screen?

entry.title: Posting System-wide Messages Using "Manage News" App
entry.content:
Introduction

For long time SAP users, they enjoy the benefit of posting and reading a system related message in SAP ECC or SAP S/4HANA systems using transaction code /sm02. From 2508 Release, SAP Cloud ERP (formerly called SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) can do the same on My Home page.  This blog discusses the details on how to create the messages called News Articles, especially how to make them visible to your intended audience.

 

Background

Until Release 2508, our customers can see a beautiful My Home page with display of software related news (see box in the below figure).  The news is limited to SAP provided features in your subscribed function areas, such as Supply Chain, Human Resources, etc.

Software related News

Many users were asking if they can post their own news in the News section.  This feature becomes available in Release 2508 so that an administrator (yes, only the user with SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR business role) can post relevant news to the users on a needed basis. Here is an example of news postings ‚Äì Hot Fix Collection 6 is going to be applied this weekend.

News Article Postings

Recently I heard some users were attempting to post their own news without much success. I tried and figured out what is the mechanism behind and would explain them in detail in this blog.

 

News Article Creation

To create a News Article, we use the Manage News app.  To launch this app, the user needs to have the business user role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR, which contains the Business Catalog SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_MNG_PC. 

When you launch the Manage News app for the first time, it should be empty, News Articles are 0, News Groups are 0 and News Images are 0.

Empty Entries in the Manage News app

Before discussing news article creation, let me explain some relevant components first.

 

News Images

Besides default images, customers can upload their own images to be used together with news articles.  For example, I downloaded one system maintenance related image from SAP‚Äôs brand image library as below.

My Image for System Maintenance News Articles

By clicking on the News Images tab, and Create button, we can create a news image called ‚ÄúSystem Maintenance‚Äù.

News Image ‚Äì System Maintenance

I also downloaded another blue Joule image to be used for Artificial Intelligence related news.  In the News Images tab, you can see these two Image entries are created.

Two Image Entries in News Images Tab

 

News Groups

News Groups are used to group relevant news articles together and display under one umbrella. For example, I have two system related News Articles

  • System Upgrade 1 for Release 2602 Upgrade
  • System Upgrade 2 for HFC 1 Upgrade

Since they are all System Maintenance related news, I put them under the same System Maintenance Group. When you check the News, you can see System Maintenance related news are all grouped together.

System Maintenance Group News

When you click on the News screen ‚ÄúSystem Maintenance‚Äù, a second window pops-up.  It lists three news

  1. Critical: System Upgrade 2
  2. Critical: System Upgrade 1
  3. Normal: Caution: Business Catalogs

Three News Articles within the System Maintenance News Group

The sequence of this group of news is most probably based on creation time.  The newly created news is on top.

In addition, one news article can belong to more than one news groups. That is the case of News Article Caution: Business Catalogs.  It belongs to two News Groups: ‚ÄúAI Joule Group‚Äù and ‚ÄúSystem Maintenance‚Äù.  I will discuss that further later.

The creation of a News Group is quite straightforward as shown below. You can also assign an image to a News Group.  This image will supersede any images assigned to a news article.

System Maintenance News Group

When you leave the Description section blank, the system will display a default message for you as shown below: Discover new features and changes of this release. 

Default News Group Description

 

News Article

Now let‚Äôs create our first News Article: System Upgrade 1 as shown below.  It is a created News Article with a background image (Blue Joule). You can further Edit it or Delete it.

System Upgrade News Article

Overall, the creation is quite straightforward.  I only explain a few entries:

  • Title and Subtitle is a combination.  You need to make it eye catching for users.
  • Footer Text could indicate its author; at least that‚Äôs how I use it.
  • Background Image is optional, but a good picture saves thousands of words.  However, if this news article is under a News Group umbrella, the image won‚Äôt show when you display the news.
  • Publish Start is tricky. If you want to see the News Article right away to verify your news, you could put a yesterday‚Äôs date here.  Otherwise, you can put your intended publish time.
  • Status: as soon you click the Create button, it changes from Draft to Published.
  • News App Assignment is not clear to me. For example, I associate ‚ÄúImport Collection‚Äù app to this News Article, but I don‚Äôt see its impact. I will update this part when I get a good answer.
  • News Group Assignment allows you to assign more than one group.  With that your news article will appear in each News Group when you click on the News section.  For example, this System Upgrade 1 news article will appear not only in System Maintenance Group, but also in AI Joule Group as shown below.

The System Upgrade 1 News Article Displayed under AI Joule Group

When you create a news article without assigning a News Group, this news article will appear as an independent (vs. belonging to a news group) entry in News section. For example, I have one news article called ‚ÄúSystem Announcement‚Äù which does not belong to any news groups. It will show by itself.

A News Article without a News GroupHere you probably noticed the background image is a glass dome.  That is the default image by the system because I didn't assign a background image to this news article.

News Display

When I first worked on Manage News app, I could not see my news articles in News Section. I found out the business catalog SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_DSP_PC must be assigned to the users for them to see the News.  This is not documented anywhere!

Let‚Äôs check this business catalog out in the Business Catalogs app.  It only serves one Fiori application, the Display News app.

Business Catalog of SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_DSP_PC

By expanding above screen to include Used in Business Role Templates tab, I found it is used in SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE business role template. Our developer probably thinks all users should have the role of SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE.  Therefore, displaying news is not a problem.  This might not be the case. Because this business role introduces a lot of Employee Self-Service apps, not necessarily adopted by all our customers.

My advice is to create a user defined business role like Z_Display_News_All_Employee which contains one business catalog SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_DSP_PC; then you assign all users to this role.  There is no need to assign a space or a page to the role.  You can transport this user defined role to your Test and Production tenants (Note: I created this blog related objects in a production tenant to limit the impact to others; you usually do this in your Dev tenant).

With the proper business catalog SAP_CORE_BC_CUX_NWS_DSP_PC assigned, I can see the News in my Fiori Launchpad ‚Äì My Home ‚Äì News.

Four News Groups Are on Display

 

Conclusion

With the above explanations, you should be able to create a news article or a group of news articles as an administrator and view them as a business user.  The Manage News app is a powerful tool to keep your users informed on your SAP Cloud ERP system.

 

Reference

  • SAP Help: Manage News
  • Blog: User Management in a Nutshell for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition

entry.title: New certificate renewal process
entry.content:
Hello Team,

 

We are currently in the process of renewing certificates for our project.
For example, the existing certificate details are as follows:
CN=*

 

We plan to replace the organization name from O=* to O=**
Previously, when a certificate expired, we followed the steps below:
Step 1: If the certificate was expired or about to expire, we generated a new CSR from STRUST and requested a signature from the business team.
Step 2: Once approved, we received the signed certificate via email and downloaded it to our local system.
Step 3: If the certificate was self-signed, we imported the Root + CA + System certificates into STRUST.
Step 4: If the certificate was local, we imported it from the system and updated it.
Step 5: After updating the certificate in the system, we distributed it across applications and, if required, performed an ICM restart for the SSL certificate to take effect.

 

Since we are now changing the organization name, we would like your suggestions on the process.
Additionally, we have observed that some certificates in the system have already expired.

 


Please advise on the next steps as well as is there any easy steps to import the certificate.


Thank you,


--- Support Assistant ---
I have a problem in transaction STRUST


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: New certificate renewal process
entry.content:
For the renewal process, if you need to update the organization name from "O=*" to "O=**" you can use the Replacement Wizard Tool. 

Using this tool, you can modify the Distinguished Name and Subject Alternative Names attributes of the certificate, generate a key pair, and create a Certificate Signing Request.

Once you have the CSR, you can proceed with your current process to request the signature from your business team. After receiving the Certificate Signing Response, you can then use the Replacement Wizard Tool to complete the import process.

In order to make use of the Replacement Wizard tool, the system must have the corrections of SAP Note 2414090 - STRUST wizard to replace existing key pairs.

This requires a minimum of SAP_BASIS:   
740    SAPKB74017
750    SAPK-75007INSAPBASIS
751    SAPK-75102INSAPBASIS

The renew process is documented in the KBA 3431066 - How to sign a certificate using the Replacement Wizard tool which you can use it as reference.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance
entry.content:
Dear Data-Enthusiasts!

Are you still unsure how your data management approach can benefit of SAP Business Data Cloud, what data products are, and which advantages SAP-managed data products bring?

Then you might want to attend our session SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, and governance (DA100) at SAP TechEd in Berlin on Tuesday, Nov 4 at 9:30 AM.

Besides the questions above, we will also discuss the role of SAP Master Data Governance and how to use it for improved data quality, analytics, and AI.

We are Florian Neukirch @FlorianN and Andreas Seifried @AndreasSeifried, looking forward meeting you during and after our lecture!

Florian is a Senior Product Management Specialist for SAP BDC&I. His focus is on Data Products, Catalog, Marketplace and Data Product Governance. Florian started his career at SAP in Solution Management and has taken over several roles in the SAP BDC&I organization since then.

Andreas is a product manager for SAP Master Data Governance and is engaged in shaping SAP‚Äôs portfolio for data management since he joined the development organization in 2004. Andreas started at SAP as a technology consultant in 2001, when he helped organizations all over the world to solve their data and process integration challenges.

We will introduce you to the concept of data products and explore how SAP-managed data products can enhance your data architecture. We'll delve into the significance of master data for analytics, processes, and AI, and discuss upcoming features like the data product studio.

Other related sessions that we recommend:

  • DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse by @kpsauer and @kurzdo93 
  • DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud by @san_tran 

Related community topic pages:

SAP Business Data Cloud | SAP Community

SAP Datasphere | SAP Community

Looking forward to seeing you in Berlin!

Florian and Andreas

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

  • What are your experiences with SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Master Data Governance?
  • Is it valid to have distinct views on (generic) data management and master data management? What are the reasons?

Please add your thoughts as comments to this blog. Thanks!

entry.title: SAP Access Management Use Cases can be enabled by SAP Gen AI
entry.content:
SAP Access Management Use Cases can be enabled by SAP Gen AI


1. Real-Time SoD Conflict Detection
Use Case: Instantly identify Segregation of Duties (SoD) conflicts for any user.
Example: ‚ÄúWhat conflicts exist for user Jacob?‚Äù
Benefit: Immediate, accurate conflict analysis.

2. Risk-Based Role Review
Use Case: Review roles based on actual risk exposure and usage.
Example: ‚ÄúShow me users with SOD risk conflicts‚Äù.
Benefit: Prioritize remediation based on real impact, not theoretical risk.

3. Usage-Based Role Optimization
Use Case: Identify unused roles or transactions to streamline access.
Example: ‚ÄúWho has Z_FB02 but never used FB02?‚Äù
Benefit: Reduce access footprint and license cost by removing unused permissions.

4. Impact Simulation for Role Changes
Use Case: Simulate the effect of removing a transaction or role.
Example: ‚ÄúIf I remove FB02 from Z_FB02, who else is affected?‚Äù
Benefit: Avoid unintended disruptions by previewing changes.

5. Alternative Role Suggestions
Use Case: Recommend safer role alternatives.
Example: ‚ÄúWhat alternative roles could work instead of Z_FB02?‚Äù
Benefit: Accelerate remediation with validated, low-risk role options.

6. Executive Risk Reporting
Use Case: Explain access risks in business terms to leadership.
Example: ‚ÄúExplain our P2P risks to the CFO‚Äù
Benefit: Translate technical risks into business impact scenarios (e.g., fraud potential).

7. Visual Risk Mapping
Use Case: Generate visualizations of risk across business processes.
Example: ‚ÄúCreate a visualization of the risk in the process flow‚Äù
Benefit: Improve stakeholder understanding and audit readiness.

8. Automated Audit Response
Use Case: Generate audit-ready reports and remediation plans.
Example: ‚ÄúGenerate a slide deck for our SoD remediation progress‚Äù
Benefit: Save time and ensure completeness in compliance reporting.

9. Access Governance Across Hybrid Landscapes
Use Case: Manage access across on-premises and cloud SAP systems.
Example: ‚ÄúShow SoD violations across Cloud SAP S4 Hana systems and ECC systems‚Äù
Benefit: Unified view of access risks across environments.

10. Token-Efficient AI Conversations
Use Case: Enable deep AI reasoning without exceeding context limits.
Example: ‚ÄúSummarize top 5 risks by transaction volume‚Äù
Benefit: Fast, cost-effective AI interactions using pre-analyzed data.

üß≠ Strategic Shift for Security Teams
Instead of being data gatherers, teams become strategic risk managers:
Focus on decision-making, not data extraction.
Use AI to triage, simulate, and remediate access risks.
Maintain audit readiness with minimal manual effort.

entry.title: Generative AI Powered IAM Business Role Augmentation (GAIRA)
entry.content:
Generative AI Powered IAM Business Role Augmentation (GAIRA) is a transformative concept for modern enterprises, shifting Identity and Access Management (IAM) from manual, reactive processes to a proactive, intelligent, and efficient system.

Limitations of traditional IAM include:

- Manual Provisioning: Managing user accounts and privileges can be time-consuming and error-prone, particularly in large organizations.
- Inflexible Security: Rule-based systems often lack the context needed to detect subtle, behavioral-based anomalies indicative of modern threats, such as insider risks.
- Compliance Burden: The manual nature of access reviews and audit trail generation drains resources and struggles to keep pace with regulatory changes.
- Subpar User Experience: Slow access request workflows can frustrate users and hinder productivity.

GAIRA addresses these challenges by integrating generative AI into the four pillars of IAM:

1. Adaptive Authentication
- Risk-Based Access: GAIRA enables continuous, risk-based authentication by analyzing user behavior, location, and device in real-time. For instance, a login attempt from an unusual location could trigger additional verification steps.
- Frictionless Security: This dynamic security approach balances convenience and trust, enhancing security without burdening trusted users.

2. Intelligent Authorization
- Automated Role Management: Generative AI analyzes historical access data and user roles to recommend optimal role assignments, significantly reducing manual effort and errors.
- Contextual Access Recommendations: For access requests needing approval, GAIRA provides context-rich insights based on peer-group comparisons and historical outcomes, facilitating faster, informed decisions.

3. Streamlined Administration
- Lifecycle Automation: GAIRA automates the entire user lifecycle, from onboarding to offboarding, dynamically assigning and removing access rights based on predefined policies and roles.
- Enhanced User Experience: Users can interact with the IAM system using natural language via conversational AI interfaces, improving productivity and reducing the burden on IT help desks.

entry.title: Recent Enhancements in SAP for Me for Partners
entry.content:
Dear Partners,

Based on your valued feedback, we have introduced new functionality and enhancements to the partner accessible dashboards in SAP for Me.

Customer Success Dashboard

Projects - Customer Implementation Survey report

Partners can now access survey results completed by customers after they complete the survey, post project implementation.

This enhancement provides partners with direct visibility into customer feedback, helping them:

  • Understand customer satisfaction and areas for improvement.
  • Track implementation success metrics.
  • Identify opportunities for follow-up or continuous improvement.

Sales & Marketing Dashboard

Reselling Business Suite via SAP Store

In the Deal Execution tab, partners can easily resell Business Suite via the SAP Store in the Open Deals card.  First, select "My Deals" from the filter option to identify the relevant opportunity, then click on Manage Deal and then Create Cart option. This will allow partners to configure their shopping card in the SAP Store, generate a quote for the customer and place the order.

Check out this video to review the end-to-end process.

Exceptional Discount Requests

In the Deal Execution tab > Exceptional Discount Requests card, partners can now upload documents to their Exceptional Discount Requests via SAP for Me, removing the requirement to provide documentation to SAP via email.

 

Partnership Dashboard

Competencies & Specializations: Enhanced view and transparency for partners and competency achievements

We‚Äôve introduced an improved experience that gives partners greater visibility into their competency progress and achievements. With this enhancement, partners can view detailed progress toward each competency requirement.

This increased transparency empowers partners to better manage their competency requirements, plan next steps proactively, and accelerate their path toward higher competency levels.

 

GSSP Download letter

To support partner autonomy, GSSP partners can now automatically generate a letter as proof of partnership letter via SAP for Me, to leverage in customer tendering processes.

Finance & Legal Dashboard

Digital Terminations

The scope of digital terminations has been extended to enable customers to trigger terminations for Cloud Choice Flex (CCFLEX) contracts via SAP for Me. Partners can trigger terminations for OEM and Test, Demo and Development contracts. Please note, only standard termination is possible.

Termination can be triggered in Finance & Legal dashboard > Cloud > Contracts

   

 

Coming soon:

Customer Success Dashboard:

  • New insights to support renewal forecasting
  • Updates to Projects Card: project view by partner group, Clean Core Quality Gate visibility and project manager assignment
  • Business AI unit consumption

Finance & Legal Dashboard:

  • Enhancements to CCLFEX Commissions card

Partner Solutions Dashboard:

  • Solex Customer Billing for Partner

Sales & Marketing

  • Enhancements to the Business Planning card

If you would like to suggest a new feature for SAP for Me, please access here. Your feedback matters and supports to shape the roadmap for SAP for Me for Partner.

entry.title: Ariba Supplier Log in issues? Find out how to get support!
entry.content:
The Ariba Supplier Help Center is your one-stop shop for all your Ariba Supplier support needs, offering a wide range of tools and resources to help you navigate the network efficiently.  

Below is the process to find answers to common queries as well as the steps to contact the Ariba Supplier Support Team should you have log in issues. 

Access the Ariba Supplier Help Center by following these steps: 

  1. Visit SAP Ariba Help Center 
  2. Select your account type. 
  3. Search in the search bar using key words for common queries and Ariba Supplier troubleshooting tips. 

Contact the Ariba Supplier Support Team by following these steps: 

  • Go to the Get Support tab in the top-left corner of the Help Center and click Contact Support. 
  • Step 1: Add your question or issue (e.g. Can not log in), then click Next (button will appear after adding your question). 

  • Step 2: Open and review the resources, then click Next. 
  • Step 3 Confirm the requested details, then click Next. 
  • Step 4: Choose from the available Contact Options.  

Depending on your account type, subscription and the nature of your issue, SAP Ariba Supplier Support will guide you towards one of the following support options: Request a Call, Chat, Email Webform.  

                                                                                                                                           

Don‚Äôt forget to continue exploring the Help Center and check out the Knowledge Base and Documentation sections for a wealth of information!  

Please see the following links for further assistance: 

Who do I contact when I have a question or issue? Ariba or Customer? 

How do I contact SAP Business Network Customer Support as a supplier?  

How do I Chat with SAP Business Network Customer Support if I cannot log into my SAP Business Network Account? 

                                                                                                                                           

Thanks for reading!‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

We hope you found this useful. Please note that the‚ÄØCustomer Interaction Center‚ÄØis always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you‚ÄØmay have.‚ÄØ

If you have any questions, please ask a questions in the Q & A using All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community and All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community

Read more ##CustomerInteractionCenter blog-posts here!
